headline: Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase to contribute $1,000 to Trump Accounts
summary: Two of the biggest U.S. banks said they would match a $1,000 federal contribution for employees who open a Trump Account, touting the plan as a way to save money.

headline: Bank Of America Extends Reach With Trump Accounts And Auto Finance Deal
summary: Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) and JPMorgan announced matching contributions to new government sponsored "Trump accounts" for American children. "Trump accounts" are described as tax advantaged investment vehicles intended to support long term savings starting in childhood. Bank of America also extended its multi year partnership with Volvo Car Financial Services, focused on auto financing. For you as an investor, these moves sit at the intersection of retail banking, wealth management, and...

headline: Trump's Iran threat boosts oil; JPM, BofA give to Trump accounts
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Wednesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute.Oil (CL=F, BZ=F) is trading at a four-month high after President Trump threatened an attack on Iran.Bank of America (BAC) and JPMorgan (JPM) announced they will be matching the US Treasury's $1,000 contribution to each "Trump account."Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Analysts Cut Bank of America (BAC) Price Targets While Staying Bullish
summary: Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC) is one of the 11 Most Profitable Cheap Stocks to Invest In Now. On January 15, TD Cowen reduced its price target on Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC) from $66 to $64 and kept its Buy rating. This update comes after the company reported Q4 2025 core earnings per share […]

headline: JPMorgan, Bank of America announce $1,000 Trump account match as corporate America support for retirement scheme deepens
summary: JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America said they will match the US government’s $1,000 contribution to so-called Trump accounts for thousands of their US employees.

raw.headline: JPMorgan, Bank of America announce $1,000 Trump account match as corporate America support for retirement scheme deepens
raw.summary: JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America said they will match the US government’s $1,000 contribution to so-called Trump accounts for thousands of their US employees.

headline: Sweatpants Are Out, Suits Are In: Why Power Dressing Is Back
summary: Bloomberg Opinion columnist Andrea Felsted joins Caroline Hepker and Lizzy Burden to discuss whether the headlong rush toward wearing ever more relaxed clothing over? That question has preoccupied investors since analysts at Bank of America Corp. called time on the sneaker boom this month. In a recent column, Felsted argues the answer is yes. Evidence from catwalks, social media, retailers and sales data shows we're wearing more sophisticated clothing and footwear again. We haven't abandoned our sneakers and sweatpants altogether. But athletic wear in everyday life looks passe. Outside of the gym, walking or running, sports-inspired shoes are starting to lose out to dressier styles.

raw.headline: Sweatpants Are Out, Suits Are In: Why Power Dressing Is Back

Evidence from catwalks, social media, retailers and sales data shows we're wearing more sophisticated clothing and footwear again. We haven't abandoned our sneakers and sweatpants altogether. But athletic wear in everyday life looks passe. Outside of the gym, walking or running, sports-inspired shoes are starting to lose out to dressier styles.

headline: This Signal Just Flashed for the First Time in 8 Years; History Says It Could Indicate a Sharp Correction Ahead
summary: The Bull & Bear Indicator from Bank of America's global fund manager survey says we are in a "hyper-bull" market right now. That tends to be a dangerous signal for stock prices looking forward.

headline: JPMorgan's 2026 NII Guide Signals Resilience: Is JPM Stock a Buy Now?

headline: Bank of America Bets on 2 Little-Known ‘Strong Buy’ AI Chip Stocks
summary: The surge in AI investment is rippling through the semiconductor supply chain in ways that go beyond GPUs and CPUs. Building and scaling modern data centers requires a growing amount of specialized connectivity and networking silicon, creating opportunities for companies positioned in the high-speed data movement segment of the market.
